Lemon Cream Pie.Description: The combination of lemon and sour cream give this pie a smooth texture and tangy taste.  Just perfect with the graham cracker crust.
Lemon Cream Pie.Equipment:
Equipment
Pie Plate (9in)
Measuring Cups
Measuring Spoons
Lemon Cream Pie.Ingredients:
Pie Filling
1 cup Sugar
3 Tbsp cornstarch plus 1-1/2 tsp
1 Tbsp grated lemon peel
1/2 cup lemon juice
3 egg yolks lightly beaten
1 cup milk
1/4 cup butter cubed
8 oz sour cream
1 cup heavy whipping cream whipped
* Lemon twists for garnish
Graham Cracker Crust
1 1/4 cup graham cracker crumbs
5 Tbsp butter melted
2 Tbsp sugar
Lemon Cream Pie.Steps:
Pie Filling
Combine sugar, cornstarch, lemon peel, juice, egg yolks and milk in heavy saucepan
Cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in butter
Cool mixture to room temperature and add in sour cream
Pour into Graham Cracker Crust
Top with Whipped Cream and garnish as desired.
Refrigerate until ready to serve
Graham cracker crust
Mix together graham cracker crumbs, melted butter and sugar with a fork
Pour the crumbs into a pie plate
Use your measuring cup to press crumbs into bottom and sides of pie plate
Bake at 325 until the crust begins to brown - about 15-20 minutes
Allow to cool and keep stored in refrigerator
Notes
If you prefer, you can use a pastry crust instead of a graham cracker crust. Use my recipe for the perfect pie crust found here.
If using a graham cracker crust, use your measuring cup to press the crumbs into the bottom and sides of the pie pan to get a nice smooth, even crust!
Lemon Cream Pie.Nutrition: Calories: 523kcal | Carbohydrates: 47g | Protein: 4g | Fat: 35g | Saturated Fat: 20g | Cholesterol: 166mg | Sodium: 266mg | Potassium: 148mg | Sugar: 33g | Vitamin A: 1160IU | Vitamin C: 7.3mg | Calcium: 108mg | Iron: 0.9mg

Orange Chicken.Description: Delicious orange chicken, just like the dish served at your favorite take out restaurant.
Orange Chicken.Ingredients:
Chicken
2 lbs boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into 1-1/2” cubes
1 ½ cups all purpose flour
1 eggs beaten
¼ tsp salt
¼ tsp pepper
Oil for frying
Orange Sauce
1 ½ cups water
2 Tbsps orange juice
¼ cup lemon juice
1/3 cup rice vinegar
2 ½ Tbsp soy sauce
1 Tbsp orange zest grated
1 Cup brown sugar packed
½ tsp ginger root minced
½ tsp garlic minced
2 Tbsp green onion chopped
¼ tsp red pepper flakes
3 Tbsp cornstarch
2 Tbsp water
Orange Chicken.Steps:
Combine flour, salt, and pepper.
Dip chicken in egg mixture and shake in flour mixture to coat.
Deep fry chicken in batches at 375 degrees in a deep fryer (or use a wok) until completely cooked.
Meanwhile, in a large saucepan combine 1 ½ cups water, lemon juice, orange juice, rice vinegar, and soy sauce.
Blend well over medium heat for a few minutes.
Stir in brown sugar, orange zest, ginger garlic, and onion. Bring to a boil.
Combine 3 tablespoons of cornstarch with 1/4 cup of water and mix thoroughly.
Slowly stir cornstarch mixture into sauce until it thickens.
Pour sauce over breaded chicken, and if desired add red pepper flakes and garnish with green onions
Orange Chicken.Nutrition: Calories: 465kcal | Carbohydrates: 65g | Protein: 37g | Fat: 4g | Saturated Fat: 1g | Cholesterol: 124mg | Sodium: 718mg | Potassium: 689mg | Fiber: 1g | Sugar: 36g | Vitamin A: 140IU | Vitamin C: 10.3mg | Calcium: 49mg | Iron: 2.6mg

California Sushi Rolls.Description: A classic sushi roll filled with fresh avocado, cucumber, and crab meat.
California Sushi Rolls.Equipment:
Equipment
Seaweed Sheets
Green Bamboo Sushi Roller Mat
Natural Bamboo Sushi Mat
Rice Paddle, Spreader
California Sushi Rolls.Ingredients:
1 ½ cups sushi rice
2 ¼ cups water
2 tablespoons seasoned rice vinegar
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon sugar
1 avocado
½ English cucumber
8 ounces imitation crab, log/leg style works better than chunks
4 sheets toasted nori seaweed
California Sushi Rolls.Steps:
Rinse off the rice in a colander. In a pot with a lid add the rice and the water. Turn heat to high and bring to a boil. Once boiling keep the lid on and reduce to low for 15 minutes until all the water has been absorbed. While the rice is cooking in a small bowl add the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. Whisk together until the sugar and salt are dissolved into the vinegar.
Once the rice is ready carefully transfer the rice to a sheet pan. Sprinkle the rice vinegar mixture over the rice and toss the rice in the vinegar to coat as much of it as possible. Now spread the rice out over the whole sheet pan making an even thin layer of rice to cool it down. Wait 10 minutes before rolling the sushi.
While the rice is cooking and cooling prepare the vegetables for filling. Thinly slice the avocado. Peel and cut the cucumber in half and use a spoon to remove the seeds, then continue to cut the cucumber into long thin strips.
While you finish waiting for the rice to cool set up your work station for rolling. You will need a sushi mat, a scoop and 1 cup measuring cup for the rice, a small bowl of room temperature water for your fingers, and a serated knife. Note to keep the water close, keeping your hands wet will keep the rice from sticking to you during the process.
Once rice is ready measure it out into a 1 cup measuring cup, you will use 1 cup of rice for each roll. Now take a sheet of seaweed and lay the shinier side down on the sushi mat, keep in the center with the bottom flush against the edge of the mat. Dip your fingers in the bowl of water letting excess water drip off. Transfer the cup of rice onto the center of the seaweed. Now with your wet fingers (you can dip them in more water if needed) spread out the rice to the flush bottom, sides, and up to the top of the seaweed until about the last inch, leave a narrow strip of seaweed uncovered at the top, about 1 inch.
Once rice is spread out in the center add a line of the avocado, crab, and cucumber.
Now carefully take the flush edge of the mat and fold it up over the fillings. Then pulling the mat tightly over the fillings creating the center of the roll. Pull down the mat off the seaweed and roll the rest of the roll up to create a log shape. Bring the mat back overtop of the log and up the log into the mat. Pick it up and gently give the whole thing a squeeze to keep it in a circular shape. Now unwrap the mat and you should have a california roll!
Dip the serated knife into the water bowl (like with your fingers to keep it from sticking). And carefully cut the sushi into 8 pieces.
California Sushi Rolls.Nutrition: Calories: 140kcal | Carbohydrates: 27g | Protein: 5g | Fat: 1g | Saturated Fat: 0g | Cholesterol: 6mg | Sodium: 642mg | Potassium: 71mg | Fiber: 1g | Sugar: 3.2g | Vitamin A: 6mcg | Vitamin C: 1.4mg | Calcium: 9mg | Iron: 0.3mg

Classic Chocolate Cake.Description: Indulge in the rich and decadent taste of this classic chocolate cake. Perfect for any celebration.
Classic Chocolate Cake.Equipment:
Equipment
Two 9-inch round cake pans
Mixing bowls
Electric mixer
Spatula
Classic Chocolate Cake.Ingredients:
Cake
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 ¾ cups granulated sugar
¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
1 ½ tsp baking powder
1 ½ tsp baking soda
1 tsp salt
2 large eggs
1 cup whole milk
½ cup vegetable oil
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 cup boiling water
Chocolate Frosting
1 cup unsalted butter, softened
1 ½ cups unsweetened cocoa powder
5 cups powdered sugar
½ cup whole milk
2 tsp vanilla extract
Pinch of salt
Classic Chocolate Cake.Steps:
Cake
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large mixing bowl, sift together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add eggs, milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed for 2 minutes.
Stir in boiling water until the batter is well combined. The batter will be thin; this is okay.
Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pans.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes. Then, remove the cakes from the pans and let them cool completely on a wire rack.
Chocolate Frosting
In a large mixing bowl, beat the softened butter until smooth and creamy.
Gradually add cocoa powder and powdered sugar, alternating with milk and vanilla extract. Beat until the frosting is creamy and fluffy.
Add a pinch of salt and mix until well combined.
Frost the cooled chocolate cakes with the chocolate frosting. You can also add some chocolate shavings or sprinkles for decoration.
Slice and serve.
Classic Chocolate Cake.Nutrition: Calories: 450kcal | Carbohydrates: 75g | Protein: 5g | Fat: 16g | Saturated Fat: 9g | Cholesterol: 45mg | Sodium: 400mg | Potassium: 230mg | Fiber: 5g | Sugar: 56g | Vitamin A: 350IU | Calcium: 60mg | Iron: 2.5mg

Vegetable Stir-Fry.Description: A healthy and colorful vegetable stir-fry that's quick and easy to make. Packed with flavor and nutrients.
Vegetable Stir-Fry.Equipment:
Equipment
Wok or large skillet
Cutting board
Knife
Vegetable Stir-Fry.Ingredients:
Stir-Fry Sauce
3 tablespoons soy sauce
2 tablespoons rice vinegar
1 tablespoon honey
1 teaspoon cornstarch
Stir-Fry
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 red bell pepper, sliced
1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
1 green bell pepper, sliced
1 cup broccoli florets
1 cup snow peas
1 carrot, sliced
1 zucchini, sliced
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced
1 pound tofu, cubed (optional)
Cooked rice or noodles for serving
Vegetable Stir-Fry.Steps:
Stir-Fry Sauce
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, and cornstarch. Set aside.
Stir-Fry
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add minced garlic and ginger, and stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add tofu cubes (if using) and stir-fry until lightly browned.
Add all the sliced vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, snow peas, carrot, zucchini) and stir-fry for about 3-5 minutes until they start to become tender but still crisp.
Pour in the stir-fry sauce and stir to coat the vegetables and tofu evenly. Continue to cook for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Serve the vegetable stir-fry over cooked rice or noodles.
Enjoy your colorful and healthy meal!
Vegetable Stir-Fry.Nutrition: Calories: 250kcal | Carbohydrates: 20g | Protein: 10g | Fat: 15g | Saturated Fat: 2g | Cholesterol: 0mg | Sodium: 350mg | Potassium: 450mg | Fiber: 5g | Sugar: 10g | Vitamin A: 120% | Vitamin C: 200% | Calcium: 10% | Iron: 15%

Spaghetti Bolognese.Description: A classic Italian pasta dish featuring rich and savory Bolognese sauce served over perfectly cooked spaghetti.
Spaghetti Bolognese.Equipment:
Equipment
Large saucepan
Skillet
Large pot
Colander
Serving platter
Spaghetti Bolognese.Ingredients:
Bolognese Sauce
1 lb ground beef
1 onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 carrot, finely chopped
1 celery stalk, finely chopped
1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes
1/2 cup red wine (optional)
2 tbsp tomato paste
1 tsp dried oregano
1 tsp dried basil
Salt and pepper to taste
Spaghetti
12 oz spaghetti
Grated Parmesan cheese for serving
Fresh basil leaves for garnish
Spaghetti Bolognese.Steps:
Bolognese Sauce
In a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium-high heat. Remove any excess fat.
In a large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion, garlic, carrot, and celery. Sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the cooked ground beef to the saucepan, along with crushed tomatoes, red wine (if using), tomato paste, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and pepper. Stir well to combine.
Simmer the sauce over low heat for at least 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. The longer you simmer, the richer the flavor.
Spaghetti
In a large pot, cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain in a colander.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti.
Garnish with grated Parmesan cheese and fresh basil leaves.
Enjoy your homemade Spaghetti Bolognese!
Spaghetti Bolognese.Nutrition: Calories: 500kcal | Carbohydrates: 45g | Protein: 25g | Fat: 22g | Saturated Fat: 8g | Cholesterol: 65mg | Sodium: 700mg | Potassium: 800mg | Fiber: 6g | Sugar: 8g | Vitamin A: 70% | Vitamin C: 20% | Calcium: 8% | Iron: 25%

Mango Salsa.Description: A refreshing and tropical salsa featuring ripe mangoes, red onions, cilantro, and a hint of lime juice.
Mango Salsa.Equipment:
Equipment
Mixing bowl
Knife
Cutting board
Mango Salsa.Ingredients:
2 ripe mangoes, diced
1/2 red onion, finely chopped
1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced (optional)
Juice of 1 lime
Salt and pepper to taste
Tortilla chips for serving
Mango Salsa.Steps:
In a mixing bowl, combine diced mangoes, finely chopped red onion, chopped cilantro, and minced jalapeño pepper (if using).
Squeeze the juice of 1 lime over the mixture.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss everything together.
Chill the mango salsa in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to let the flavors meld.
Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for grilled chicken or fish.
Enjoy the tropical flavors of Mango Salsa!
Mango Salsa.Nutrition: Calories: 60kcal | Carbohydrates: 15g | Protein: 1g | Fat: 0g | Saturated Fat: 0g | Cholesterol: 0mg | Sodium: 5mg | Potassium: 170mg | Fiber: 2g | Sugar: 11g | Vitamin A: 25% | Vitamin C: 60% | Calcium: 2% | Iron: 2%

Chicken Alfredo.Description: Creamy and indulgent Chicken Alfredo pasta with tender chicken breast and fettuccine noodles in a rich Alfredo sauce.
Chicken Alfredo.Equipment:
Equipment
Large skillet
Large pot
Colander
Serving platter
Chicken Alfredo.Ingredients:
Chicken
2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
Salt and pepper to taste
1 tbsp olive oil
Fettuccine Alfredo
8 oz fettuccine pasta
2 cups heavy cream
1/2 cup unsalted butter
1 1/2 cups grated Parmesan cheese
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped fresh parsley for garnish
Chicken Alfredo.Steps:
Chicken
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken breasts and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 6-7 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and let rest.
Fettuccine Alfredo
In a large pot, cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain in a colander.
In the same skillet used for chicken, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly thickened.
Add grated Parmesan cheese and stir until the sauce is smooth and creamy. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Slice cooked chicken into strips and add to the Alfredo sauce. Stir to combine.
Serve the Chicken Alfredo over cooked fettuccine pasta. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
Indulge in the creamy goodness of Chicken Alfredo!
Chicken Alfredo.Nutrition: Calories: 750kcal | Carbohydrates: 38g | Protein: 35g | Fat: 52g | Saturated Fat: 30g | Cholesterol: 240mg | Sodium: 700mg | Potassium: 450mg | Fiber: 2g | Sugar: 3g | Vitamin A: 160% | Vitamin C: 2% | Calcium: 50% | Iron: 2%

Greek Salad.Description: A fresh and vibrant Greek salad featuring crisp cucumbers, juicy tomatoes, tangy olives, and creamy feta cheese.
Greek Salad.Equipment:
Equipment
Mixing bowl
Knife
Cutting board
Greek Salad.Ingredients:
Salad
2 cucumbers, diced
4 tomatoes, diced
1 red onion, thinly sliced
1 cup Kalamata olives, pitted
1 cup feta cheese, crumbled
Fresh oregano leaves for garnish (optional)
Greek Dressing
1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
2 tbsp red wine vinegar
1 tsp dried oregano
Salt and pepper to taste
Greek Salad.Steps:
Salad
In a mixing bowl, combine diced cucumbers, diced tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, pitted Kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese.
Toss the salad ingredients together until well combined.
Greek Dressing
In a small bowl, whisk together extra-virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the Greek dressing over the salad and toss to coat all the ingredients.
Garnish with fresh oregano leaves (if available).
Serve this refreshing Greek Salad as a side dish or a light meal.
Greek Salad.Nutrition: Calories: 250kcal | Carbohydrates: 15g | Protein: 7g | Fat: 19g | Saturated Fat: 7g | Cholesterol: 25mg | Sodium: 600mg | Potassium: 350mg | Fiber: 4g | Sugar: 7g | Vitamin A: 15% | Vitamin C: 35% | Calcium: 20% | Iron: 10%

Grilled Salmon.Description: Enjoy the savory flavor of grilled salmon with a hint of lemon. A healthy and delicious meal.
Grilled Salmon.Ingredients:
Salmon
4 salmon fillets
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 lemon, sliced
Salt and pepper to taste
Marinade
1/4 cup olive oil
2 tablespoons lemon juice
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 teaspoon dried oregano
1 teaspoon dried thyme
1 teaspoon paprika
Salt and pepper to taste
Grilled Salmon.Steps:
Marinade
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, dried thyme, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Place the salmon fillets in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to marinate.
Grilled Salmon
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Remove the salmon fillets from the marinade and season with salt and pepper.
Place the salmon fillets on the grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork and has grill marks.
During grilling, baste the salmon with the remaining marinade and add lemon slices for extra flavor.
Serve the grilled salmon with your choice of sides and enjoy!
Grilled Salmon.Nutrition: Calories: 300kcal | Carbohydrates: 3g | Protein: 25g | Fat: 20g | Saturated Fat: 3g | Cholesterol: 70mg | Sodium: 150mg | Potassium: 650mg | Fiber: 1g | Sugar: 1g | Vitamin A: 6% | Vitamin C: 15% | Calcium: 2% | Iron: 6%
